page.title: 10WOODLAND
page.content: The area is covered by 112 hectares of woodland.{Crag Wood}has deciduous trees,{Black Hills}has evergreen and deciduous trees,{Cottingley Wood {(private)}is mainly pine trees and {Ruin Bank Wood}has conifer trees. The woodland floors are covered with dried leaves and dead wood (which is decomposing). Under fallen trees and on the floor there are spiders, common beetles and many other small insects. On the trees there are aphids, moths and a few flying insects. In parts, large areas of woodland floor are covered with bluebells and ferns. The woods have many mammals and birds in them which include badgers, rabbits, foxes and small rodents (mice etc.). There are paths in and around most of the woodland areas. {COMPILED BY: { Bladen,Ward,Hamilton,Parker
